headline: 'The Five' on Democrats taking all the credit

utterances.speaker: JEANINE PIRRO, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Hello everyone. I'm Judge Jeanine Pirro along with Geraldo Rivera, Jesse Watters, Dana Perino and Greg Gutfeld. It's 5:00 in New York City and this is THE FIVE. COVID mandates are finally going away and Democrats say you should be thanking Joe Biden for getting your freedom back. If it sounds like a joke, sadly it's not. Despite the fact that the White House and CDC are not budging an inch from their mask mandates, liberals are demanding that you heap praise on the president.

utterances.speaker: JEN PSAKI, WHITE HOUSE PRESS SECRETARY
utterances.sentences: The president has been clear and has said that we are moving toward a time when COVID won't disrupt our daily lives, a time when COVID won't be a constant crisis.

utterances.speaker: REP. HAKEEM JEFFRIES (D-NY)
utterances.sentences: Under President Biden's leadership, a public health infrastructure was put into place to ensure that we can do everything possible to crush the virus.

utterances.speaker: REP. SEAN MALONEY (D-NY)
utterances.sentences: -- of whether there should be a blanket mandates for businesses and other public areas is a step that here in New York we feel comfortable taking because of the success of the president's policies.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: And then there's the media. Remember how they smeared Republicans and accuse them of wanting to kill Americans by refusing restrictions? Their opinions much different now that Democrats are on board.

utterances.speaker: JOY REID, MSNBC HOST
utterances.sentences: Here's the thing with death Santis. He denies. He denies the efficacy of mask and vaccines.

utterances.speaker: NORAH O'DONNELL, CBS NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: The first glimmer of hope and what could be life after the pandemic.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: We know Glenn Youngkin's true colors is that is MAGA red.

utterances.speaker: KATE BOLDUAN, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: More signs of the country is pushing to get back to normal.

utterances.speaker: JOE SCARBOROUGH, MSNBC HOST
utterances.sentences: COVID politics makes a lot of Republican governors stupid.

utterances.speaker: JOHN BERMAN, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: These are all states led by Democrats and once hard-hit COVID zones and they seem to be decisions driven by science not politics.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: All right. It seems like the Democrats are changing their tune, Jesse. Is this science or political science?

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Its political science. And what does that mean you're following the science? It's like the race car, it's lost all meaning. Next time, you know, you do something that makes your boyfriend or your girlfriend or your spouse angry, just say, hey, babe I was following the science. You'll see how far that gets you. It doesn't get you anywhere. What does that even mean? If the Democrats are doing what they are doing, are they following the science? And which science? The same science that started the pandemic? The mad scientist that cooked this thing up in the lab? A million Americans are dead. It's like the highest death toll, crushed families and small businesses and they're like, all right, here peasant, take your freedom back and here's a side of inflation. I don't like what's going on with the masks. What usually happens when you make someone put something on their body or on their face, it's very personal to do that. And you see that in the Army. They make you shave your head or gangs, they make you wear a collar or get a tattoo. And it's kind of like a soft kind of form of submission. Once you get some to do that to their body, it makes you able to control them a lot easier. So once they've gotten that down, Fauci even said that masks don't do anything. Its kind about getting the country in this -- in the zone where we were all on the same team to fight this thing together. And by the way, has anybody asked Fauci about the Johns Hopkins Study? I don't think anybody has asked him about that. Someone needs to -- maybe our very own stupid son of a bitch can ask him that next time.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Well, you know, will -- after all this Dana, will Americans trust the left because this is so obvious.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think there's a lot of -- there's a distrust across the board is down for institutions. And it's not just even with COVID, it's across the board. If you think about what happened in the -- all the institutions from the 20th century do not feel like they are up to the 21st century challenges that we are experiencing. I think the White House trying to take credit and the Democrats, I understand why they are trying to do it, but I do find it a little bit hard to swallow. And they probably would have gone a lot farther if they would have said what a collective action, look at all that we did together. Thank you for wearing the mask. Thank you for getting vaccines. Thank you to the scientists who figured out the pills, the treatments, the monoclonal antibodies, all of those things. And let's move forward. I think that you're gearing up to see something probably before the Super Bowl weekend that's -- so that maybe Friday or Saturday from the CDC that says okay, actually, masks can be optional and you'll see if they'll try to do something so that the president when he does his interview with Lester Holy of NBC which is a traditional thing --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You are smart.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- he'll have something to say.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You are on to something.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I might be, but the other thing I noticed in the White House briefing today, all of the reporters were peppering Jen Psaki with questions about these mask mandates. One thing that's really difficult is that their political legs have been cut out from under them because the Democrats in the states as I understand it, the governors were asking the White House to take this action before they did. There was no action and so they decided to move on their own and so they're kind of like standing there without any policy.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes. You know, Geraldo, now the blue state governors in spite of the fact that they're going against, you know, Biden and the CDC, are seen as the heroes. And the red state governors like DeSantis are seen -- still seen as the villains standing in the way.

utterances.speaker: GERALDO RIVERA, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: That's media. I don't care about media. I care about reality and it's clear --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: No, that's Psaki. That's Psaki who said that DeSantis was standing in the way, not the media.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: But she's a politician and --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No she's not.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: But she speaks to the president.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: She's not a politician.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Well, I think that she's in a hyper-charged political role as a surrogate for the president and that's it.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: So she gets to be political.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: She gets to be political, but I don't care. I want everybody in the country to breeze through COVID as easy as I did. I don't know if the - - I don't know if masks worked or didn't work. It doesn't matter. They tried. They were in a panic. They were facing, Jesse mentioned, a million dead Americans. They were doing the best they could given the information they had. I think the demonizing of one side or the other is really pathetic. It will end and the test will be this. The people who are most against masks are the people who are against vaccination also. If these prohibitions, the vaccine mandate and the mask mandate go away, it will be interesting to see what happens. If the people who've been against masks and vaccines all along don't get sicker at an accelerated rate and then they don't die at an accelerated rate then they were right all along. But you can't -- you can't attribute bad faith to either side. Everybody was fine.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Fauci I can attribute bad faith to. He says that masks don't work and that he is the science. If masks don't work why are we masking our kids?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: And why did the Japanese wear masks for decades?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: No, no, no. This isn't about the Japanese. It's about our American kids, the most vulnerable.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: He was (inaudible), come on judge.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: No, right now they're wearing masks.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I want --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Okay.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I still feel funky when I see someone without a mask around.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Well, that's your issue. It's time for us to be free.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: You feel funky?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Funky.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You feel funky?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Funky?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Like pull on the gang. (Inaudible) parliament.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: All right, Greg. Greg, you want to wrap this up.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I would love to wrap this up. I think we should welcome the Democrats for coming around. That's the noble thing to do that to say, hey, finally you guys got here. It could have been sooner, but we're so glad you finally figured it out. But now that they're taking a victory lap, I have to say that more people died under Joe Biden who had the vaccine and the therapeutics than under Trump who had neither. Trump had the added disadvantage of Joe and Kam trashing the vaccine which obviously led to tens of thousands of deaths. See I'm doing my best impression of a liberal when Trump was president. They have blood on their hands. I haven't said that in a few weeks. So that's what you would say if they're -- after they take the victory lap. I have an analogy. If-- where is it? Do you ever do a school project?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And then there's one --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: The volcanoes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: -- there's one guy -- I did a volcano. And there's one guy in the group who does nothing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But at the end he tries to take credit for everyone else's work.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Why you looking at me?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, you would like that, but that's Joe Biden, right? The Republican governors, they did all the heavy lifting. They took all the risks.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They decided to start the parade, you know, to end this stuff. And for him to take credit when he had no skin in the game and never did any risk asses assessment is wrong. I have a rule. If you didn't really help me move out of my apartment then don't show up when the pizza's being served. You will get no slices. Right now -- Joe's the guy who never shows up for work and then he's suddenly always there at the Christmas party hanging around under the mistletoe.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Sniffing your hair.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Do you think -- do you think Trump did all he could have to push vaccines?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Oh my god. Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He was excited. I didn't think --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: All he could have --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: By the way, you can always do better. You can always do better. But the vaccine thing --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: He disappeared for months.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He changed -- wait, Trump?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: What are you talking about?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: He disappeared.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: He was in front of the American people.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You're confusing Trump with Biden. Biden was in his basement disappearing.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Biden was hiding the whole campaign.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: After the president lost the election he could have still pushed vaccines. He could have still said the epidemic is still with us.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, I think that's unreal (ph).

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Oh, come on.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Can I mention one other thing?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes, go ahead.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: The Oscars have announced that there's --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- there's no vaccine requirement and no mask at the Oscars. I hope that is true for the staff that has to work it.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Oh, good point.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Watch for that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, I hope they have to wear masks.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Isn't it amazing. Hollywood now --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So we can make fun of them?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: And the people who sell lipstick.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: -- not requiring vaccines. All right, up next, President Biden Getting Homeland Security involved over reports the trucker protest is coming to the Super Bowl.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The trucker protest rocking Canada could be heading to the Super Bowl next and it's got Joe Biden pretty worried. So, he's calling up his Department of Homeland Security for a pre-emptive crackdown. The agency warning police to prepare for protests similar to Canada's "Freedom Convoy" and that U.S. based truck drivers could start blocking highways and major roads in California ahead of the Super Bowl. Biden's state of the union address could also be impacted. Administration officials very concerned.

utterances.speaker: PSAKI
utterances.sentences: We support peaceful protest but we have concerns when those protests turn violent. And certainly I think it's important for everyone in Canada and the United States to understand what the impact of this blockage is.

utterances.speaker: ALEJANDRO MAYORKAS, DHS SECRETARY
utterances.sentences: Once they intervene in other people's freedoms and liberties, it becomes a more complicated landscape, but we're working with law enforcement to address any eventualities.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right. So, Greg, I knew that they were starting in California. I heard maybe they were coming east, but I don't want to mess up the Super Bowl.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, but I do choose the truckers over the trackers. I don't buy this what if stuff. We've seen this -- what they've done is they're mapping this after the strategy they used with terror. Remember there was any kind of big event --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, we have to make sure that the terror threat level will go up at the Super Bowl if there could be an ISIS attack at this. All they're doing is they're transferring that framework to people who have yet to commit any crime.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I mean, I would love to see the DHS like taze a baby. When they go to these events, what do you see? Every picture you see are families, a bouncy castle. But what they're doing right now is they're doing their bad appling, right? They find a flag or they plant a flag or they dig up a two- year-old flyer from Miami and they claim, oh my god, this entire convoy, they are terrorists. They're white supremacists. It's a political tactic to smear your opponents. I mean, you know, I know Geraldo gets really mad when an illegal immigrant commits a crime and like say painting a swastika on a capitol building and then we'd bring it up and you think, oh my god, we're smearing all illegal immigrants. Well that's what the -- that's what the White House is doing right now. And who knew that Canadians do a better job of Americans than Americans do, although their prime minister is a disgrace but you know, what can you do?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: So they have the DHS secretary there. I mean, he's already there. The Super Bowl is not till Sunday, but he is there and he is ready, Dana. Where is Mayor Pete? Is he gonna get out there and just, you know, stop the truckers single-handedly?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't think so. Remember it took him like five months to go to the L.A. port. Initially, January 15th is the date that the Canadian government said that truckers were basically no longer essential workers after they had worked two years as essential workers. And all of a sudden with the stroke of a pen, they were -- and it's not that they're not vaccinated. Many of them are vaccinated and it always is groundswell. Trudeau had two and a half weeks or so to get ready for this. They didn't do anything. They didn't go meet with them. They didn't try to de-escalate. Didn't try to figure it out. Well, the White House has had plenty of warning. One, they've not caught -- where's President Biden? Why hasn't he called Trudeau? Let's get this figured out. Can we do something on cross- border passing so that we can make sure that people can get back to work?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Has he called Trudeau? I mean, probably not.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I don't know. I keep asking. I don't believe so. They say that they're -- that the White House has been in touch with their counterparts, okay. But also this is another great opportunity for Kamala Harris. California is her home state. Don't laugh. I'm just like let me give you a little more advice. So, Kamala Harris could go. I would get Buttigieg and I would get Marty Walsh, the labor secretary.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, Marty.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And I would go out there and I would --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Marty.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Marty could go.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All those guys and I would -- I would at least meet with them try to figure it out and say look, the governors, do you like this plan, do you like this plan? Can we get to some sort of agreement to try to hit it off? If not, they're just going to have more problem.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Whatever happened in negotiation? You can't negotiate with truckers?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Well --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You can negotiate with the Taliban, but not the truckers?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: You can't negotiate if you think that you control the people who want to negotiate with you. And that is the problem here. Look, these truckers are saying look at what you've done to us. For two years you destroyed our lives, our businesses, our families have been affected. You wouldn't listen to us. Now that you see elections are coming around, you don't want to talk to us. You now still refuse to deal with the fact that you have destroyed our lives that we were essential, and now you want to quarantine us if we don't -- if we aren't vaccinated, if we go in the other direction, whereas 90 percent are clearly vaccinated. And so this this sense of elitism that are -- that both Trudeau has saying I saw a swastika and it's an inherent sign of violence. It is, I agree. But I haven't seen anything, I haven't heard about a lot of arrests there. You've got thousands of people --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It was on Twitter. That's all it takes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Yes. All it takes is Twitter, but what they're doing is they're going to come to the United States because people are fed up. And for the first time people feel that they've got something to say. And the other point that I want to make here is that they're creating the narrative and you're absolutely right.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: They who?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: They, meaning the White House is creating a narrative that, you know, we're not going to allow any violence. We're worried about disrupting the auto production. Well, how long -- two years we've been down now. Now you're worried about it. And we have concerns that this is going to turn violent. How do you know it's going to turn violent? Are you just cultivating that seed in the minds of Americans?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Lots of concerns, Geraldo. Lots of concerns.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Well, I must say, Jesse, that I am deeply embarrassed by the affection, the misguided affection you all are heaping on these truckers.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You're embarrassed by us?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I am embarrassed.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What a turnaround.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I am embarrassed.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I didn't know you could feel that emotion.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: We have to look at naked pictures of you.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Do you know that -- do you know that in Canada, the Toyota plant and the Ford plant are already closing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: A whole week because these thugs have cut off --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Thugs?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: -- the supply of parts --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Wait a second.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: -- to these factories. They have put these people out of work. How dare they?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Geraldo, the --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: What about -- hold it, hold it. I let you talk --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The government shutdown the whole economy for a year.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Don't tread on me. The Gadsden flag, the yellow flag with the snake, we all rally around, free personal freedom. What about that? What about don't tread on me? What about have they -- they have --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They didn't burn the plant down like BLM did.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: -- they have staggered -- they have staggered the Canadian economy much more in terms of dollar and disruption than Minneapolis and the other Black Lives Matter.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What!

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You're out --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You're so out of line on that one.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Two billion. Geraldo, it cost $2 billion.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Billions of dollars.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: I can't believe it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You said you can't say that. You need to have stats.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: These people are the people who don't have power.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Say the stats.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Tens of millions of dollars, $400 million a day.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: How much in a day? Billions. It was billions.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: $400 million a day --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: Okay, multiply that by a year and a half.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: -- add it up in two and a half days that's a billion. You --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Billions.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: These truckers are selfish, self-involved.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.sentences: They're good -- they are hardworking people who want to be heard.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Geraldo, don't call them self-involved. I have to see pictures of you every day.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: -- you care about their politics. What about -- they cut off -- they cut off -- they cut off trade between the nations.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I know how to break you.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: They are affecting national security and shame on them and shame on anyone who cheers them on.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I don't think you even believe what you're saying, Geraldo, but that's why we like you. Americans having some serious buyer's remorse with Joe Biden. We will explain that next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I am. Another major milestone for the Biden presidency. He is now failing on all fronts. The guy who promised competency has turned into a defective product Americans would like to return. Biden's average approval rating dropping below 40 percent for the first time and maybe this is why. Here's how Joe's talking about record inflation.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
utterances.sentences: The fact is that we're in a situation now where, you know, you should have peace of mind. We're working to bring down prices where they are not totally what the families, in fact, have to pay now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Peace of mind. Sounds like his mind is in pieces. And it was probably tough for CNN to report on these brutal numbers.

utterances.speaker: JOHN KING, CNN CHIEF NATIONAL CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: Look at how bad these numbers are for the president. Only four in 10 Americans, 41 percent at the moment, approve of his job performance. Nearly six in 10, 58 percent disapprove. That's a tough number early in a midterm election year for the president of the United States. Now, why is this happening? This is fascinating. We asked people, what has President Biden done for you that you approve of? Fifty-six percent of Americans, nearly six in 10 Americans. That means a decent amount of Democrats said nothing. They disapprove of everything that has happened.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know, Geraldo, I am personally embarrassed by anyone who has to defend this awful abysmal presidency. He should probably either be impeached or we should invoke the 25th amendment. I would be personally embarrassed for anybody who disagreed with that, Geraldo, personally embarrassed.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You sound so -- I won't say it, but I will say this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I did it.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You can't say -- he will say this. I will say this. This president and you saw him struggling to communicate right there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: A lot of his problem is that he cannot communicate. He is an old man who sounds like an old man and when you have problems from Afghanistan to inflation to COVID to everything else to deal with, you have to be able to tell the American people with verve and elan and charisma that they're going to be okay. And when he talks he tends to look -- mumble around to his microphone and look around and forget the guy's name again and here. And that I think is a lot of the problem is his -- he may be a very substantive fellow, but he cannot -- he cannot portray that any confidence and we need a confident president.
