Despite the fact that the White House and CDC are not budging an inch from their mask mandates, liberals are demanding that you heap praise on the president.

utterances.speaker: JEN PSAKI, WHITE HOUSE PRESS SECRETARY
utterances.utterance: The president has been clear and has said that we are moving toward a time when COVID won't disrupt our daily lives, a time when COVID won't be a constant crisis.

utterances.speaker: REP. HAKEEM JEFFRIES (D-NY)
utterances.utterance: Under President Biden's leadership, a public health infrastructure was put into place to ensure that we can do everything possible to crush the virus.

utterances.speaker: REP. SEAN MALONEY (D-NY)
utterances.utterance: -- of whether there should be a blanket mandates for businesses and other public areas is a step that here in New York we feel comfortable taking because of the success of the president's policies.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: And then there's the media. Remember how they smeared Republicans and accuse them of wanting to kill Americans by refusing restrictions? Their opinions much different now that Democrats are on board.

utterances.speaker: JOY REID, MSNBC HOST
utterances.utterance: Here's the thing with death Santis. He denies. He denies the efficacy of mask and vaccines.

utterances.speaker: NORAH O'DONNELL, CBS NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: The first glimmer of hope and what could be life after the pandemic.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.utterance: We know Glenn Youngkin's true colors is that is MAGA red.

utterances.speaker: KATE BOLDUAN, CNN HOST
utterances.utterance: More signs of the country is pushing to get back to normal.

utterances.speaker: JOE SCARBOROUGH, MSNBC HOST
utterances.utterance: COVID politics makes a lot of Republican governors stupid.

utterances.speaker: JOHN BERMAN, CNN HOST
utterances.utterance: These are all states led by Democrats and once hard-hit COVID zones and they seem to be decisions driven by science not politics.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: All right. It seems like the Democrats are changing their tune, Jesse. Is this science or political science?

utterances.speaker: JESSE WATTERS, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: Its political science. And what does that mean you're following the science? It's like the race car, it's lost all meaning. Next time, you know, you do something that makes your boyfriend or your girlfriend or your spouse angry, just say, hey, babe I was following the science. You'll see how far that gets you. It doesn't get you anywhere. What does that even mean? If the Democrats are doing what they are doing, are they following the science? And which science? The same science that started the pandemic? The mad scientist that cooked this thing up in the lab? A million Americans are dead. It's like the highest death toll, crushed families and small businesses and they're like, all right, here peasant, take your freedom back and here's a side of inflation. I don't like what's going on with the masks. What usually happens when you make someone put something on their body or on their face, it's very personal to do that. And you see that in the Army. They make you shave your head or gangs, they make you wear a collar or get a tattoo. And it's kind of like a soft kind of form of submission. Once you get some to do that to their body, it makes you able to control them a lot easier. So once they've gotten that down, Fauci even said that masks don't do anything. Its kind about getting the country in this -- in the zone where we were all on the same team to fight this thing together. And by the way, has anybody asked Fauci about the Johns Hopkins Study? I don't think anybody has asked him about that. Someone needs to -- maybe our very own stupid son of a bitch can ask him that next time.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Well, you know, will -- after all this Dana, will Americans trust the left because this is so obvious.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think there's a lot of -- there's a distrust across the board is down for institutions. And it's not just even with COVID, it's across the board. If you think about what happened in the -- all the institutions from the 20th century do not feel like they are up to the 21st century challenges that we are experiencing. I think the White House trying to take credit and the Democrats, I understand why they are trying to do it, but I do find it a little bit hard to swallow. And they probably would have gone a lot farther if they would have said what a collective action, look at all that we did together. Thank you for wearing the mask. Thank you for getting vaccines. Thank you to the scientists who figured out the pills, the treatments, the monoclonal antibodies, all of those things. And let's move forward. I think that you're gearing up to see something probably before the Super Bowl weekend that's -- so that maybe Friday or Saturday from the CDC that says okay, actually, masks can be optional and you'll see if they'll try to do something so that the president when he does his interview with Lester Holy of NBC which is a traditional thing --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You are smart.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- he'll have something to say.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You are on to something.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I might be, but the other thing I noticed in the White House briefing today, all of the reporters were peppering Jen Psaki with questions about these mask mandates. One thing that's really difficult is that their political legs have been cut out from under them because the Democrats in the states as I understand it, the governors were asking the White House to take this action before they did. There was no action and so they decided to move on their own and so they're kind of like standing there without any policy.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes. You know, Geraldo, now the blue state governors in spite of the fact that they're going against, you know, Biden and the CDC, are seen as the heroes. And the red state governors like DeSantis are seen -- still seen as the villains standing in the way.

utterances.speaker: GERALDO RIVERA, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: That's media. I don't care about media. I care about reality and it's clear --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: No, that's Psaki. That's Psaki who said that DeSantis was standing in the way, not the media.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: But she's a politician and --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No she's not.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: But she speaks to the president.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: She's not a politician.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Well, I think that she's in a hyper-charged political role as a surrogate for the president and that's it.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: So she gets to be political.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: She gets to be political, but I don't care. I want everybody in the country to breeze through COVID as easy as I did. I don't know if the - - I don't know if masks worked or didn't work. It doesn't matter. They tried. They were in a panic. They were facing, Jesse mentioned, a million dead Americans. They were doing the best they could given the information they had. I think the demonizing of one side or the other is really pathetic. It will end and the test will be this. The people who are most against masks are the people who are against vaccination also. If these prohibitions, the vaccine mandate and the mask mandate go away, it will be interesting to see what happens. If the people who've been against masks and vaccines all along don't get sicker at an accelerated rate and then they don't die at an accelerated rate then they were right all along. But you can't -- you can't attribute bad faith to either side. Everybody was fine.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Fauci I can attribute bad faith to. He says that masks don't work and that he is the science. If masks don't work why are we masking our kids?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: And why did the Japanese wear masks for decades?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: No, no, no. This isn't about the Japanese. It's about our American kids, the most vulnerable.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: He was (inaudible), come on judge.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: No, right now they're wearing masks.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I want --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I still feel funky when I see someone without a mask around.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Well, that's your issue. It's time for us to be free.

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.utterance: You feel funky?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Funky.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You feel funky?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Funky?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Like pull on the gang. (Inaudible) parliament.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: All right, Greg. Greg, you want to wrap this up.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I would love to wrap this up. I think we should welcome the Democrats for coming around. That's the noble thing to do that to say, hey, finally you guys got here. It could have been sooner, but we're so glad you finally figured it out. But now that they're taking a victory lap, I have to say that more people died under Joe Biden who had the vaccine and the therapeutics than under Trump who had neither. Trump had the added disadvantage of Joe and Kam trashing the vaccine which obviously led to tens of thousands of deaths. See I'm doing my best impression of a liberal when Trump was president. They have blood on their hands. I haven't said that in a few weeks. So that's what you would say if they're -- after they take the victory lap. I have an analogy. If-- where is it? Do you ever do a school project?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And then there's one --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: The volcanoes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: -- there's one guy -- I did a volcano. And there's one guy in the group who does nothing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But at the end he tries to take credit for everyone else's work.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Why you looking at me?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, you would like that, but that's Joe Biden, right? The Republican governors, they did all the heavy lifting. They took all the risks.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They decided to start the parade, you know, to end this stuff. And for him to take credit when he had no skin in the game and never did any risk asses assessment is wrong. I have a rule. If you didn't really help me move out of my apartment then don't show up when the pizza's being served. You will get no slices. Right now -- Joe's the guy who never shows up for work and then he's suddenly always there at the Christmas party hanging around under the mistletoe.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Sniffing your hair.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Do you think -- do you think Trump did all he could have to push vaccines?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Oh my god. Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He was excited. I didn't think --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: All he could have --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: By the way, you can always do better. You can always do better. But the vaccine thing --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: He disappeared for months.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He changed -- wait, Trump?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: What are you talking about?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: He disappeared.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: He was in front of the American people.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You're confusing Trump with Biden. Biden was in his basement disappearing.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Biden was hiding the whole campaign.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: After the president lost the election he could have still pushed vaccines. He could have still said the epidemic is still with us.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, I think that's unreal (ph).

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Oh, come on.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Can I mention one other thing?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes, go ahead.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: The Oscars have announced that there's --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- there's no vaccine requirement and no mask at the Oscars. I hope that is true for the staff that has to work it.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Oh, good point.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Watch for that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, I hope they have to wear masks.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Isn't it amazing. Hollywood now --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So we can make fun of them?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: And the people who sell lipstick.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: -- not requiring vaccines. All right, up next, President Biden Getting Homeland Security involved over reports the trucker protest is coming to the Super Bowl.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The trucker protest rocking Canada could be heading to the Super Bowl next and it's got Joe Biden pretty worried. So, he's calling up his Department of Homeland Security for a pre-emptive crackdown. The agency warning police to prepare for protests similar to Canada's "Freedom Convoy" and that U.S. based truck drivers could start blocking highways and major roads in California ahead of the Super Bowl. Biden's state of the union address could also be impacted. Administration officials very concerned.

utterances.speaker: PSAKI
utterances.utterance: We support peaceful protest but we have concerns when those protests turn violent. And certainly I think it's important for everyone in Canada and the United States to understand what the impact of this blockage is.

utterances.speaker: ALEJANDRO MAYORKAS, DHS SECRETARY
utterances.utterance: Once they intervene in other people's freedoms and liberties, it becomes a more complicated landscape, but we're working with law enforcement to address any eventualities.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. So, Greg, I knew that they were starting in California. I heard maybe they were coming east, but I don't want to mess up the Super Bowl.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, but I do choose the truckers over the trackers. I don't buy this what if stuff. We've seen this -- what they've done is they're mapping this after the strategy they used with terror. Remember there was any kind of big event --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, we have to make sure that the terror threat level will go up at the Super Bowl if there could be an ISIS attack at this. All they're doing is they're transferring that framework to people who have yet to commit any crime.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I mean, I would love to see the DHS like taze a baby. When they go to these events, what do you see? Every picture you see are families, a bouncy castle. But what they're doing right now is they're doing their bad appling, right? They find a flag or they plant a flag or they dig up a two- year-old flyer from Miami and they claim, oh my god, this entire convoy, they are terrorists. They're white supremacists. It's a political tactic to smear your opponents. I mean, you know, I know Geraldo gets really mad when an illegal immigrant commits a crime and like say painting a swastika on a capitol building and then we'd bring it up and you think, oh my god, we're smearing all illegal immigrants. Well that's what the -- that's what the White House is doing right now. And who knew that Canadians do a better job of Americans than Americans do, although their prime minister is a disgrace but you know, what can you do?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: So they have the DHS secretary there. I mean, he's already there. The Super Bowl is not till Sunday, but he is there and he is ready, Dana. Where is Mayor Pete? Is he gonna get out there and just, you know, stop the truckers single-handedly?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't think so. Remember it took him like five months to go to the L.A. port. Initially, January 15th is the date that the Canadian government said that truckers were basically no longer essential workers after they had worked two years as essential workers. And all of a sudden with the stroke of a pen, they were -- and it's not that they're not vaccinated. Many of them are vaccinated and it always is groundswell. Trudeau had two and a half weeks or so to get ready for this. They didn't do anything. They didn't go meet with them. They didn't try to de-escalate. Didn't try to figure it out. Well, the White House has had plenty of warning. One, they've not caught -- where's President Biden? Why hasn't he called Trudeau? Let's get this figured out. Can we do something on cross- border passing so that we can make sure that people can get back to work?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Has he called Trudeau? I mean, probably not.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't know. I keep asking. I don't believe so. They say that they're -- that the White House has been in touch with their counterparts, okay. But also this is another great opportunity for Kamala Harris. California is her home state. Don't laugh. I'm just like let me give you a little more advice. So, Kamala Harris could go. I would get Buttigieg and I would get Marty Walsh, the labor secretary.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, Marty.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And I would go out there and I would --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Marty.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Marty could go.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All those guys and I would -- I would at least meet with them try to figure it out and say look, the governors, do you like this plan, do you like this plan? Can we get to some sort of agreement to try to hit it off? If not, they're just going to have more problem.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Whatever happened in negotiation? You can't negotiate with truckers?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Well --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You can negotiate with the Taliban, but not the truckers?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: You can't negotiate if you think that you control the people who want to negotiate with you. And that is the problem here. Look, these truckers are saying look at what you've done to us. For two years you destroyed our lives, our businesses, our families have been affected. You wouldn't listen to us. Now that you see elections are coming around, you don't want to talk to us. You now still refuse to deal with the fact that you have destroyed our lives that we were essential, and now you want to quarantine us if we don't -- if we aren't vaccinated, if we go in the other direction, whereas 90 percent are clearly vaccinated. And so this this sense of elitism that are -- that both Trudeau has saying I saw a swastika and it's an inherent sign of violence. It is, I agree. But I haven't seen anything, I haven't heard about a lot of arrests there. You've got thousands of people --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It was on Twitter. That's all it takes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes. All it takes is Twitter, but what they're doing is they're going to come to the United States because people are fed up. And for the first time people feel that they've got something to say. And the other point that I want to make here is that they're creating the narrative and you're absolutely right.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: They who?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: They, meaning the White House is creating a narrative that, you know, we're not going to allow any violence. We're worried about disrupting the auto production. Well, how long -- two years we've been down now. Now you're worried about it. And we have concerns that this is going to turn violent. How do you know it's going to turn violent? Are you just cultivating that seed in the minds of Americans?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Lots of concerns, Geraldo. Lots of concerns.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Well, I must say, Jesse, that I am deeply embarrassed by the affection, the misguided affection you all are heaping on these truckers.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You're embarrassed by us?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I am embarrassed.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What a turnaround.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I am embarrassed.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I didn't know you could feel that emotion.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We have to look at naked pictures of you.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Do you know that -- do you know that in Canada, the Toyota plant and the Ford plant are already closing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: A whole week because these thugs have cut off --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Thugs?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: -- the supply of parts --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Wait a second.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: -- to these factories. They have put these people out of work. How dare they?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Geraldo, the --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: What about -- hold it, hold it. I let you talk --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The government shutdown the whole economy for a year.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Don't tread on me. The Gadsden flag, the yellow flag with the snake, we all rally around, free personal freedom. What about that? What about don't tread on me? What about have they -- they have --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: They didn't burn the plant down like BLM did.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: -- they have staggered -- they have staggered the Canadian economy much more in terms of dollar and disruption than Minneapolis and the other Black Lives Matter.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What!

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You're out --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You're so out of line on that one.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Two billion. Geraldo, it cost $2 billion.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Billions of dollars.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: I can't believe it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You said you can't say that. You need to have stats.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: These people are the people who don't have power.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Say the stats.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Tens of millions of dollars, $400 million a day.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: How much in a day? Billions. It was billions.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: $400 million a day --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Okay, multiply that by a year and a half.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: -- add it up in two and a half days that's a billion. You --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Billions.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: These truckers are selfish, self-involved.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: They're good -- they are hardworking people who want to be heard.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Geraldo, don't call them self-involved. I have to see pictures of you every day.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: -- you care about their politics. What about -- they cut off -- they cut off -- they cut off trade between the nations.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I know how to break you.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: They are affecting national security and shame on them and shame on anyone who cheers them on.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I don't think you even believe what you're saying, Geraldo, but that's why we like you. Americans having some serious buyer's remorse with Joe Biden. We will explain that next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I am. Another major milestone for the Biden presidency. He is now failing on all fronts. The guy who promised competency has turned into a defective product Americans would like to return. Biden's average approval rating dropping below 40 percent for the first time and maybe this is why. Here's how Joe's talking about record inflation.

utterances.speaker: JOE BIDEN, PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
utterances.utterance: The fact is that we're in a situation now where, you know, you should have peace of mind. We're working to bring down prices where they are not totally what the families, in fact, have to pay now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Peace of mind. Sounds like his mind is in pieces. And it was probably tough for CNN to report on these brutal numbers.

utterances.speaker: JOHN KING, CNN CHIEF NATIONAL CORRESPONDENT
utterances.utterance: Look at how bad these numbers are for the president. Only four in 10 Americans, 41 percent at the moment, approve of his job performance. Nearly six in 10, 58 percent disapprove. That's a tough number early in a midterm election year for the president of the United States. Now, why is this happening? This is fascinating. We asked people, what has President Biden done for you that you approve of? Fifty-six percent of Americans, nearly six in 10 Americans. That means a decent amount of Democrats said nothing. They disapprove of everything that has happened.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, Geraldo, I am personally embarrassed by anyone who has to defend this awful abysmal presidency. He should probably either be impeached or we should invoke the 25th amendment. I would be personally embarrassed for anybody who disagreed with that, Geraldo, personally embarrassed.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You sound so -- I won't say it, but I will say this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I did it.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You can't say -- he will say this. I will say this. This president and you saw him struggling to communicate right there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: A lot of his problem is that he cannot communicate. He is an old man who sounds like an old man and when you have problems from Afghanistan to inflation to COVID to everything else to deal with, you have to be able to tell the American people with verve and elan and charisma that they're going to be okay. And when he talks he tends to look -- mumble around to his microphone and look around and forget the guy's name again and here. And that I think is a lot of the problem is his -- he may be a very substantive fellow, but he cannot -- he cannot portray that any confidence and we need a confident president.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. I would agree with him. He doesn't instill any confidence, judge, I mean --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: The man has never had a plan for anything.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: He came into office and he said he was going to unite the country. He didn't unite the country at all. And then, you know, he said, I think it was on December 10th. He said inflation was a bump in the road. Well, it's about to crack all our skulls at this point going forward. And the other thing is, you know, this man has a socialist plan to solve America's financial problems, okay. He's got a trillion dollar COVID bill that's not even being used for COVID. The latest is they're taking $30 million out to buy crack pipes to make them safe to give them away to people when it should be used for COVID.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's a Hunter initiative.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes, that -- but that's a separate (inaudible).

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: That's what it's called.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: I just want to finish this. When asked what he did that people approve of, 56 percent couldn't think of one thing that he approve of. Do you know why? Because the guy ran from the basement. The whole thing, it was a Trojan horse, it was a fraud. And you know what, he should have to have some kind of cognitive test and the 25th amendment should kick in. And that's all I have to say.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: If we should all volunteer to take a cognitive test, and then --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: I would.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Too risky. Too many hits to the head, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Do you notice when Joe sinks worse and worse into this muck, Jesse, the media does more stories on Trump. Now, it's like Trump flushed paper down a toilet. That's like raging all over in the other networks.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. The lower Joe goes, the higher Trump goes up on their headlines.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I really think he's in the 20s. And let me explain why. It is a crime to be a Democrat president in this day and age and be anywhere near the 30.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: It's so right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You have Soros money, you have big tech, you have big labor, you have everything. It's like being six foot 10 and not being able to dunk. Just -- you get an inch off the ground and you're in. And he's -- the man can't get an inch off the ground.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You guys -- you white guys can't jump.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's true. That is true.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Racist.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I can't even get a half an inch, but that's true. That's good stereotyping. We approve of that. What happened here is not only did Biden fall not once, not twice, but three times up the stairs. Not only is his son under criminal investigation for Chinese money laundering, not only is the border wide open right now, Americans lives are so expensive. You put that on top of they're more dangerous, and you have a guy who's -- I'm not going to say it like Geraldo, but this guy is in so much trouble. The Democrats are starting to sound like Republicans. They say they want to cut the gas taxes now to help Americans before the Midterms.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Don't do anything, right, Dana?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Bad idea at this point.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, that was -- that was two very vulnerable Democrats, Mark Kelly and Maggie Hassan from New Hampshire and Arizona, because they realize that they got to do something because they have to find a way to separate themselves from President Biden. This past weekend, after the jobs numbers on Friday were better than people expected, there are all these articles that rant about Joe Biden's comeback and how this was all going to start. And then you had these numbers that came out today, perhaps they lag, but I think that the CNN numbers, those are pretty bad. It's a very interesting question that they asked, can you name one thing that he did for you? And 56 percent of people say no. The other thing is, it's just our timing is so bad. Today, he makes Abigail Spanberger have this event down in Virginia with him. And the sign up behind him is Build Back Better and says lowering costs for families, on the day the inflation number was coming out. Now, they know the day that the inflation numbers coming out. You could have like held that or change the sign or something. The timing is weird.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think the sign said build crack better. That was the sign.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: How do you do that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know what -- but you know what, speaking of crack -- speaking of crack, we have 100,000 overdoses a year now and it's almost all fentanyl. If Biden actually attack that and appointed Hunter who has a relationship with China, we know, and understands drug addiction to fight the fentanyl scourge, that would be massive. That would be something -- what do you think, Dana? That's like one of your ideas.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think that's -- I'm going to put that in my great pointing journal.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Thank you. Thank you. I know Joe watches this show.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: This sarcasm was dripping from that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I hope it's sarcasm. All right, up next, Al Sharpton scolded by the left after daring to speak out against brazen crime.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: If you're swinging as a liberal right now, you call out crime at your own peril. Left-wing activist Nikole Hannah-Jones, author of the highly controversial 1619 Project, ripping into Al Sharpton, of all people, for being concerned about brazen thefts. The Rev angry at that Trader Joe's guy. Remember that hoodlum who this week helped himself to 10 steaks?

utterances.speaker: AL SHARPTON, AMERICAN CIVIL RIGHTS ACTIVIST
utterances.utterance: You go to a local pharmacy, Duane Reade or Rite Aid, any of them, and you got to get someone to help assist you. I mean, we're talking about basic stuff. What did I miss that we now have to lock up toothpaste? I mean, you cannot have a culture where people are just at random just robbing and stealing and is out of control.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: First of all, Al Sharpton is the number one civil rights leader in this country, hands down. I don't care who any other Congresswoman. He is - - he is the person.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: He is much more important -- he is much more important, I think, in terms of the civil rights activism than President Obama.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Hannah-Jones, the author of 1619 Project tweeting this at Al Sharpton saying, "This drumbeat for continued mass incarceration is really horrific to watch. A person stealing stake is not national news. And there have always been thefts from stores. This is how you, Al Sharpton, legitimize the carceral state. In other words, putting people in jail. So she doesn't want to imprison anybody, Judge.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Of course, she doesn't want to present anybody. She's on the left. Let me tell you how crazy this all is. First of all, Al Sharpton is worried about his toothpaste. Al Sharpton is complaining about steaks. Why aren't they worried about children in the inner city who don't even respond when they hear the sound of a gun, who are getting shot in their own homes in their own beds? I'm not going to -- I'm not going to stick with that for very long. Here's the thing that infuriates me. We've got a woman 59 arrests and fights with elderly women to steal their purses, no jail. A judge orders release, OK. Why -- we got to go after the judges? And then, it's because of the DA Alvin Bragg, who lets a 30-year-old career criminal committed felony, robbery that we talked about, went into a TJ Maxx with a scissor, let him out on petty larceny. What does the guy do? He comes out and he bashes a garbage collector, a sanitation worker. He bashes him in the head and, you know now, we've got a guy who is out not just to commit another crime thinking maybe another theft, he's committing assaults. We are allowing and these people are allowing all of them -- us to be the victims and don't care anymore about the rest of us. They only care about themselves.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Right Aid is closing, all the other drugs -- I remember covered Freddie Gray in Baltimore 2015, the big Rite Aid they put to change the neighborhood, brought -- raped really by looters, closed. Aren't these people really harming the community in a way that should spur a carceral state? You got to put them someplace.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You do, Geraldo. And she says this isn't national news. That network spent a week on a guy who smirked at an Indian banging a drum. Remember that Covington kid? He smirked and that was their lead story for a week. So, it's not that the guys steal steak, it's the brazenness of the crime, you know. And she doesn't -- she doesn't want people to focus on the brazenness because the brazenness is shocking. And when people are shocked by crime, they want someone to respond to it. And the Democrats don't have a response to crime. It's like there's always going to be crime. There's always going to be shootings. But if there's a shooting in Times Square, people are going to get pissed, right? I mean, if there's like a carjacking and then a congresswoman's car gets carjacked, that's a little different. So, it's like where does it stop? Like, some guy is going to steal something usually, you try to hide it in your pocket, and then you run away from security. Now, guys are walking out with whole steaks, with some guys going to walk out of the butcher shop with the whole cow, Geraldo. They're going to steal your girlfriend next. Walk out of a store with your girlfriend over your shoulder, slippery slope, Geraldo. They stole your steaks, girlfriends are next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: God.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Nikole Hannah Jones clearly -- oops (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's not mine, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's a Rolex, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: That's my watch?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'll take that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: That's a Cartier. That's a Cartier. You love Cartier.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's a victimless crime, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I'll give you a steak for it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's not a national story.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I wonder does this undermine Nikole Hannah-Jones credibility?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Did she ever have any?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I have to tell you, everybody check out Dan McLaughlin's piece in the National Review where he takes her down completely today. I mean, she's a complete bully and this is ridiculous. And no, she doesn't have any credibility. Can I mention one thing that you might have -- might not have seen. Today, in Georgia, which is a swing state, right, in the capital city, Atlanta has, of course, been rocked by crime. The State Senate of Georgia today voted 52 to zero to allow private citizens to get a tax break for writing checks to the local police department, because they have to figure out a way to refund the police.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's pretty good.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Because of all of that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You mean, to get donation to cops?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, so that you could figure out a way -- and you could --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: It's OK with me.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- because -- well, but -- OK, I think it's good. But also, we wouldn't have to do this if defund the police wasn't an issue in the first place.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: It and yet you have a whole mindset as clearly Nikole Hannah Jones represents where the carceral state where jail itself is the problem not the crime.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right. And they have -- but they have no alternatives. And they love the new word, carceral. It makes them sound so smart. These crimes --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I had to look it up.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: These crimes disproportionately hurt Black and Brown people who rely on these stores which are closing in New York City, in Oakland, Berkeley, San Francisco --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Baltimore.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Baltimore. So, it's safe to say that Nikole Hannah-Jones doesn't care about Black people, as you said earlier, unless she can make a buck off them by creating this fiction, this whatever project. She doesn't give a damn about Black people because they're the ones -- she must not shop at Rite Aid or Duane Reade or Walgreens. Obviously, Sharpton does because the elderly go there. They need to go someplace local that's near their apartments. You close that, then they have to walk further, making them targets for mugging. She doesn't care about Black people. That should be her next book.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: And you know what?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And it won't be fiction.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: And the argument about incarceration is the guy that Alvin Bragg let go on a non-violent crime, committed a violent crime when he was out. So, don't tell me they shouldn't be jailed.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You call it the 2022 Project.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, there you go.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Give me my watch.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Call it the 911 Project. All right, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Oh, here's my watch. I've had this watch a long time, but it does fall off occasionally. Up next, you ever use one of these emojis while texting? I do. Well, you could be a racist.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Woke America has a new target. That's your emojis. NPR getting brutally mocked over an article that takes issue with ones that we use while texting, excuse me, especially the default yellow thumbs up. I use it a lot. It took three NPR writers interviewing an emoji researcher and other academic experts in the apparent field to determine this. Some White people may choose the yellow emoji because it feels neutral, but some academics argue, out of the white skin emoji signals a lack of awareness about white privilege akin to society associated whiteness with being raceless. Yes, I read this at 5:00 a.m. I said we got to talk about this. First of all, three reporters to do this, Greg, is one thing. But also, the yellow emoji is first.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's a default --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Have you notice that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's a default. And my problem is I identify as white, but my thumb identifies as brown. I don't want to tell you how but it's disgusting. Look, think about the fact that these people have parents, the people who wrote this article have parents. And so, the parents like, will be sitting around and somebody said, what's your -- what's your kid up to? Oh, he's a heart surgeon. Oh, she's a captain in the Air Force. My daughter wrote a piece on emojis at the NPR saying --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: With two other people.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: With two other people, and I'm going to leave now.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Do you use this emoji, Judge?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes, I never thought about it. It's just the one there.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, white privilege. There we go.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Racist.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: I guess. I mean, I don't know. I mean, now, every time I look at it, I'm going to have to move around --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's exactly what they want. That's exactly what they want.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: -- think another second and think like what color is the right color. I mean, it depends.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't know. What do you think, Geraldo?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, I think that mine should be like a creamy, savories, tropical, salsa tan. I want to be that. Do they have that one?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They don't?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: They don't have the Rico Suave. I want to be Rico --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: How about one with a diamond ring on it?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You're being marginalized.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: How about a green thumb?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: A green thumb. That's a good one.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: That's not racist.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know what, you should have Tom Thumb because you're tiny.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I'm worried about what you're thinking about at 5:00 in the morning.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I mean, I don't know. I've always -- if I text my Black friends, I use Black emojis. And when I text my White friends, I use the White emoji. Doesn't everybody do that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes, everybody does, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think that's what the move is, right? You guys don't do that?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'm surprised that those academics didn't come up with that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And who need Emoji experts?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: All I can -- all I can say is --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. You might actually be considered more racist if you go out of your way to then make sure everything you do is the white one.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Is there a white one?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Because I think most people just do the first one that comes up.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There is no research that says -- that says paying this much attention to race makes you a better person. It makes you completely nuts.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: My chef --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Well, how about paying this much attention to an emoji.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Your chef?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You know, I had the other chef emoji?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, the chef.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He's Black. My chef is Black.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You have a chef?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I locked -- I locked in a Black chef somehow. I don't know how I do it. But whenever I use the chef emoji, he's a Black guy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There you go.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Yes. Sometimes you just --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Jesse doesn't have a chef.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, I don't have a chef.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He'll have a chef soon though.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And I don't care what color he is as long as he makes really good food.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: (INAUDIBLE) on primetime. "ONE MORE THING" is up next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You have a chef?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Why is it a he and not a she?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK, I'll take a woman chef too.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: It's time now for "ONE MORE THING," and I go first. All right, did you know that according to a recent survey, 82 percent of Americans fell in love with their dogs at first sight? So, I definitely fell in love with my poodle. That's me and red.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: That's adorable.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: OK, this -- and that's -- this is when I first met them. Red and Tatar in the back. The seller whom I got them for is not so in love with them. And then the next picture is them watching me go to work. They're very upset at the top, OK. And this is me on Saturdays when we go for errands. I just have my truck with them in the back. And this is the inside of the truck with them. They all have their positions. There's Ted for Halloween. And this is us watching television in the den. And this is that when they get back from the groomers, Red, Ted, and Stella.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Don't stop.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Don't stop.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Red, Ted and --

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Stella.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We should have a whole hour of just poodles.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: All right, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I like the poodles as well. If you watch Fox News, you know Bill Hemmer. Bill Hemmers is from Cincinnati. He is so excited because the Bengals are going to the Super Bowl this weekend. And I learned about Cincinnati Skyline Chili from Hemmer and we have some for everybody here. This is from a restaurant that Bill Hemmer highly recommends. It's called Edwards Restaurant in Tribeca. It's a Skyline Chili so this is actually legit. It actually comes from Cincinnati. It's made of a mix of meat and spices served over spaghetti and top with cheese and then they gave us some Coneys which are hot dogs topped with the chili and the cheese. This is all to help the Bengals win. Greg, you're not going to dig in?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Go, Bengals.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There's a few things in there that will ruin my taping.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You have a show to do. You have a show to do.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I have a show to do.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's pretty good? You're all right?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, it is good. It is good. It got a nice spice in there.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: We hear you. We hear you.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Judge, you have to call on someone next.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes. Now, I'm eating. Sorry. Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK. So, we have Mom Text. It's been a while. All right, number one, be safe tonight. No tumbling over the edge like Joe Rogan. Don't worry. I know what not to say. How in the name of heaven do you find the arrogance to claim that your positions, and your recommendations, and your information was accurate versus the CDCs? Whoa, please, hush.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Oh, nice, Mom.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Number three, don't say crap. Gutfeld is a very bad influence. Seriously, well-done honeybun. I love that you're reading the Times for another perspective. I've really should have kept that to myself. And last, THE FIVE is quick, smart, informative, though twisted right. But you all acknowledge your skew and I've come to appreciate the talking points with much desperately needed humor. Thanks. And God bless Geraldo and Harold.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I love your mommy.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: That's so sweet. All right, Greg, your next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right tonight, great show. It's a special, very special Thursday episode. It's kind of a surprise. But let's do this. Greg's other countries have weirder animals. Whenever I see these animal videos, I'm like what happened to America? We're just not number one anymore in weird animals. Let's check out this wombat. This is in Canberra, the Australian capital territory. These are amazing marsupials. They're native to Australia, much like every weird animal. Australia is just a country of weird animals. But this is a group of wombats known as wisdom. And their closest relative is actually the koala. They're an incestuous little bunch. And they can run as fast as humans. Look at that. What the hell is it?

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: All right, Geraldo, hit it.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: All right, it's Geraldo's Geraldo news with Geraldo featuring Lake Erie. Lake Erie, Cleveland on Lake Erie, fabulous Lake. I'm always on the lake. But the season ends early there, October. But my colleagues there in Ohio, they take advantage of Lake Erie even in the snow and ice. Where's that video, snow and ice? There they are towing boats out on the ice.

utterances.speaker: PIRRO
utterances.utterance: All right, that's it for us. "SPECIAL REPORT" is up next. Hey Bret.
